DOC.HEAD: CBS Executive Tisch Buys Bank of Boston Stock
Eds: Restores dropped word `million' in 3rd graf.
DOC.TEXT: An investment group including CBS chairman and chief executive Lawrence A. Tisch has purchased 6.6 percent of the Bank of Boston Corp., filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission show. Tisch and his partners bought the stock for investment purposes and have no intention of seeking control of the bank, according to the filings Tuesday. The $94.5 million investment was made by Tisch, other members of his family and FLF Associates, a New York-based firm that represents four of Tisch's sons. The group said it holds 4.7 million common shares in the bank, and plans to review its investment from time to time. The group said it might increase or decrease its holdings, depending on market and other conditions. Tisch is also chairman of Loews Corp., which owns CNA Financial Insurance, Lorrilard Tobacco, and 25 percent of CBS. Bank of Boston's stock has declined steadily and is in its lowest price range since 1985. The bank recently announced a $125 million third quarter loss due to problems with real estate construction loans. Bank of Boston stock closed up 1] at 18[ Tuesday.
